acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia in a transfer of court records from Prince Edward County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Prince Edward County was named in honor of Edward Augustus, a son of Prince Frederick Louis, a grandson of King George II, and a younger brother of King George III. The county was formed from Amelia County in 1753. The county court first met on 8 January 1754. The county seat is Farmville.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Prince Edward County (Va.) Smallpox Hospital Commission Records, 1836, includes a report and financial transactions related to the construction of a smallpox hospital. The hospital was constructed with slave labor.
